results.title: Violin GPS pitch maps : the math is sound
abstracts: This is a self-published book by Dan Fu, which seeks to provide a visually concise and comprehensive solution to violin fingering calculation. It includes a shorthand method for more precise score annotation, which replaces fingering numbers.

results.title: Twelve lessons and duets for the advancing flautist
abstracts: In this book, the author seeks to bridge the difference between the beginner and intermediate levels of flute playing, through enhancing the basic techniques and principles.

results.title: Advancing collaborative learning with ICT : conception, cases and design
abstracts:
This monograph is written with the intent to advance collaborative learning (CoL) with information and communication technologies (ICT) in Singapore schools. As group work becomes a common approach to learn in today’s
classrooms, this monograph aims to seed ideas on how group work can be characterised as collaboration.

results.title: Self-directed learning with ICT : theory, practice and assessment
abstracts:
This monograph about Self-Directed Learning (SDL) is written with the Singapore educational context in mind, particularly within the context of formal schooling. It also explores the use of information and communication
technologies (ICT) when promoting SDL in different learning scenarios.

results.title: Creating the early literacy classroom : activities for using technology to empower elementary students / Jean M. Casey.
abstracts: Now you can implement the ideas and research findings of Jean Casey's Early Literacy to help students become successful readers and writers. These flexible, engaging activities can be used across the grade levels. They will motivate students and empower them to design their own projects, create their own written products, and above all, be in control of their learning. A must for every educator, this book is especially useful to those involved in English as a Second Language, Special Education, and Gifted programs.

abstracts: "Brilliant ... important reading for those who teach music, who write the curricular plans for teaching it, and who guide prospective teachers to the profession ... It is a must-read, for it awakens thoughts about why we teach and how."--Patricia Shehan CampbellThis quintet of essays examines the reasons why music education should be transformed, investigates the nature of education and musical transformation, and suggests alternative educational models and strategies. Estelle Jorgensen frames her argume.

results.title: Beyond the book : technology integration into the secondary school library media curriculum / Sandra L. Doggett ; edited by Paula Kay Montgomery.
abstracts: What does the secondary school library media specialist need to know about technology in the twenty-first century? This book answers the question with a wealth of practical information. Doggett explores the pros and cons of using technology in the schools and describes how it affects the roles and interaction of media specialists, teachers, students, administrators, school system, community, and parents. She also demonstrates how to get off to a successful start with technology. Various research processes, emerging technologies, filtering, and search engines are just some of the topics covered.

results.title: Learning and instruction in the digital age / J. Michael Spector [and others], editors.
abstracts: Instruction tailored to the individual student, learning and teaching outside the limits of time and space--ideas that were once considered science fiction are now educational reality, with the prospect of an intelligent Web 3.0 not far distant. Alongside these innovations exists an emerging set of critical-thinking challenges, as Internet users create content and learners (and teachers) take increased responsibility in their work. Learning and Instruction in the Digital Age nimbly balances the technological and pedagogical aspects of these rapid changes, gathering papers from noted researchers on a wealth of topics relating to cognitive approaches to learning and teaching, mental models, online learning, communications, and innovative educational technologies, among them: Cognition and student-centered, Web-based learning The progression of mental models throughout a course of instruction Experiencing education with 3D virtual worlds Expanding educational boundaries through multi-school collaboration Adapting e-learning to different learning styles The student blog as reflective diary With its blend of timely ideas and forward thinking, Learning and Instruction in the Digital Age will enrich the work of researchers in educational psychology, educational technology, and cognitive science.

results.title: Beyond the book [electronic resource] : technology integration into the secondary school library media curriculum / Sandra L. Doggett ; edited by Paula Kay Montgomery.
abstracts: What does the secondary school library media specialist need to know about technology in the twenty-first century? This book answers the question with a wealth of practical information. Doggett explores the pros and cons of using technology in the schools and describes how it affects the roles and interaction of media specialists, teachers, students, administrators, school system, community, and parents. She also demonstrates how to get off to a successful start with technology. Various research processes, emerging technologies, filtering, and search engines are just some of the topics covered.

results.title: The art of teaching music / Estelle R. Jorgensen.
abstracts: The Art of Teaching Music takes up important aspects of the art of music teaching ranging from organization to serving as conductor to dealing with the disconnect between the ideal of university teaching and the reality in the classroom. Writing for both established teachers and instructors on the rise, Estelle R. Jorgensen opens a conversation about the life and work of the music teacher. The author regards music teaching as interrelated with the rest of lived life, and her themes encompass pedagogical skills as well as matters of character, disposition, value, personality, and musicality. She reflects on musicianship and practical aspects of teaching while drawing on a broad base of theory, research, and personal experience. Although grounded in the practical realities of music teaching, Jorgensen urges music teachers to think and act artfully, imaginatively, hopefully, and courageously toward creating a better world. - Publisher.

results.title: 爱与放手 : 亲职性教育生涯规划11堂课 / 吕嘉惠著.
abstracts: 社会快速发展下, 孩子俨然已经浸泡在性的环境下长大, 如果家长缺席, 让孩子在性上面自学, 结果往往适得其反! 但是, "性教育"要不要教? 几岁教? 教什么? 怎么教? 请记得, 亲子关系的日常互动, 就是性教育最重要的现场, 同时我们应该让孩子在有爱的关系中, 学习各种能力 ~ "依附关系为主体的亲职性教育"是最好的性教育方式! 性教育绝不只是教生理构造和器官、杜绝性侵害、克制自己和对方的欲望..... 更要让孩子能够尊重自己的感觉、爱自己的身体、爱自己的性别、爱他自己这一个人, 且知道有人(最好是家长)会爱他 ~ 本书强调全人性教育, 是家长送给自己与孩子最好的礼物!.

results.title: Learning science through computer games and simulations [electronic resource] / Committee on Science Learning: Computer Games, Simulations, and Education ; Margaret A. Honey and Margaret L. Hilton, editors ; Board on Science Education, Division of Behavioral and Social Sciences and Education, National Research Council of the National Academies.
authors: National Research Council (U.S.). Committee on Science Learning: Computer Games, Simulations, and Education.
abstracts: At a time when scientific and technological competence is vital to the nation's future, the weak performance of U.S. students in science reflects the uneven quality of current science education. Although young children come to school with innate curiosity and intuitive ideas about the world around them, science classes rarely tap this potential. Many experts have called for a new approach to science education, based on recent and ongoing research on teaching and learning. In this approach, simulations and games could play a significant role by addressing many goals and mechanisms for learning science: the motivation to learn science, conceptual understanding, science process skills, understanding of the nature of science, scientific discourse and argumentation, and identification with science and science learning. To explore this potential this book reviews the available research on learning science through interaction with digital simulations and games. It considers the potential of digital games and simulations to contribute to learning science in schools, in informal out-of-school settings, and everyday life. The book also identifies the areas in which more research and research-based development is needed to fully capitalize on this potential. It will guide academic researchers, developers, publishers, and entrepreneurs from the digital simulation and gaming community, and education practitioners and policy makers toward the formation of research and development partnerships that will facilitate rich intellectual collaboration. Industry, government agencies and foundations will play a significant role through start-up and ongoing support to ensure that digital games and simulations will not only excite and entertain, but also motivate and educate.

results.title: Blended learning in higher education [electronic resource] : framework, principles, and guidelines / D. Randy Garrison, Norman D. Vaughan.
abstracts: "This groundbreaking book offers a down-to-earth resource for the practical application of blended learning in higher education as well as a comprehensive examination of the topic. Well-grounded in research, Blended Learning in Higher Education demonstrates how the blended learning approach embraces the traditional values of face-to-face teaching and integrates the best practices of online learning. This approach has proven to both enhance and expand the effectiveness and efficiency of teaching and learning in higher education across disciplines."--Jacket.

results.title: The complete idiot's guide to playing the piano and electronic keyboards [electronic resource] / by Brad Hill.
abstracts: Includes index.

results.title: Differentiated assessment [electronic resource] : how to assess the learning potential of every student / Evangeline Harris Stefanakis ; foreword by Deborah Meier.
abstracts: "A comprehensive assessment system for working with underperforming students This book describes a comprehensive assessment system especially appropriate for multilingual and "differentiated" classrooms with large numbers of underperforming students. Drawing from Multiple Intelligences theory, the approach is specifically aimed at helping teachers understand how each student learns and how best to tailor instruction to serve individual students' needs. Although the program makes use of conventional standardized tests and disability screenings, it places special importance on two approaches in particular: Student Portfolio Assessments and Personalized Learning Profiles. Provides detailed guidance and practical tools (including a DVD) for implementing successful portfolio and "profile" practices in the classroom. Includes real-world examples of model assessment programs from five schools. Explains how to integrate assessment into the instructional process as well as how the portfolio program can be used. Formal profiles provide vital information about each student's cultural background, interests, strengths, and capabilities as well as their individual learning and language needs."-- Provided by publisher.

results.title: 男孩都是外星人 : 全世界最简单易懂的男孩性教育 / 野岛那美作 ; Kayoko Abe漫画 ; 伊之文翻译.
abstracts: 男孩为何总是把手伸进裤子里? "男孩的生殖器和体格怎样发育?" "男孩从什么时候开始对性产生兴趣?" "男孩的性教育要如何教?" 男孩性教育不是丢给爸爸就好! 其实, 儿子更需要妈妈的关注与呵护! 根据青少年性教育知识调查指出, 现在的孩子"性知识程度超前"! 超过7成的小学生表示了解如何避孕. 这些避孕知识竟有４成是来自同学、朋友和网路......但, 让孩子这样学性知识, 妈妈安心吗? 在日本辅导超过12,000人的性教育专家野岛那美, 为男孩妈妈们写的性教育专书! 以轻松诙谐的情境漫画搭配浅显易懂的解说, 让本书成为亲子间"谈天说性"的最佳沟通工具, 帮助家长减轻育儿的不安与烦恼, 同时也教会孩子从小建立身体权意识, 并透过正确的性教育告诉孩子"如何保护自己"、"懂得珍惜自己和别人", 以及"不要成为性犯罪的加害者或受害者"等性教育核心价值. 以正确的方式和孩子谈性, 用爱把他教成一个珍惜自己、肯定自我的独立个体!.

results.title: 超数位读国学 : 用数据探索制作教案, 用思辨引导深度讨论 / 邱诗雯著.
abstracts: 数位与人文如何跨领域对话? 人文背景的师生该如何培养数位思维的触角? 数位与人文不是对立二元的两端, 伴随着科技的发展, 数位人文成为新兴的研究领域, 开启我们的无限想像. 这本书应用学习鹰架, 从文史哲案例入门, 结合数位方法, 逐步引领读者理解电脑运算文本的规则. 同时伴随六大主题, 提供深度讨论问题, 深化人文素养教学内容. 本书为教育部教学实践研究绩优计画亮点成果, 希望能够抛砖引玉, 邀集更多同好一起探索数位人文观看世界之道.

results.title: 有时混黑道, 有时弹钢琴 / 铃木智彦著 ; 许郁文译.
abstracts: 为了能够亲自弹奏〈Dancing Queen〉, 即便遇到黑道打架的阻碍, 也要拚命练习. 某一天, 突然就被打到了. 那是ABBA的〈Dancing Queen〉. 我想用自己的双手在黑白琴键上演奏这首曲子. 我想学钢琴. 连乐谱都不会看的我打电话给附近的钢琴教室, 电话那头似乎相当困扰. 幸好丽子老师坦率地说: "只要练习, 没有不会弹的曲子. "原来, "为了练会某首曲子而反复练习, 和打电动打到破关的道理是一样的. ""只有出了社会, 才真正懂得学习的滋味. ""就算是很晚才开始学, 也不会有任何损失. ""练习绝对不会背叛你. "52岁硬汉大叔亲自示范, 无论几岁, YOU CAN DANCE.

results.title: 在家学更好!温柔亲子性教育 : 从幼龄到青春期, 尊重生命&自我保护  / 福地麻美, 村濑幸浩著 ; 吕沛余译.
abstracts: 从生命源头、青春期变化、性别关系到教孩子保护自己......在生活中建立与孩子无话不谈的温柔性教养, 打造正向紧密的家庭关系! 我们的家, 就是学习性教育最适合的场所! 在每天的家庭对话中, 传达"私密部位是什么"、"小婴儿如何出生"等, 一起讨论有关性的各种问题, 或遭受不舒服对待时的应对方法......亲子互相认识与同理, 培养彼此的信赖与尊重! "性"是人与人结合、活出幸福人生不可或缺的重要议题. 父母在家面对"性"的态度, 将大大影响孩子的价值观、如何看待他人, 以及对性的想法和感受. 性教育不只能守护孩子的幸福, 也是培养孩子未来生存能力的重要素养!.

results.title: 青春期女孩身体的祕密 : 生理心理知识成长书 : 给小女孩的第一本影响一生的安全性教育 / 陈文晴作 ; 赵蕴华绘 ; 杨雨杰插图.
abstracts: 女孩的成长从小学中年级就要开始注意啰! 身为父母、家长的您, 有发现女儿的身体、心灵已经有些微转变了吗? 如果只是想破头要解码少女心, 单方面要孩子"主动"向您开口分享身体的变化和内心的想法, 是很难的喔. 爸爸、妈妈和家长们, 请您们先来做点什么吧! 请主动和孩子来场性教育对谈. 本书作者在书中化身拉芙姐姐, 教导最适度的性教育观念, 带大、小读者认识女孩青春期身体发育, 从说明性器官、选择穿内衣、卫生棉、看妇产科等专业知识, 到和朋友相处、有喜欢的人、被拒绝后的心灵沟通, 以及亲子共读篇的"怀孕一定会成功吗?"、"青春期的自慰"等议题, 让父母、孩子都能一同正经又亲密的讨论. 在复杂多元的世界中, 每一位家长都需要掌握青春期正向发展关键期, 教出有爱有力量的小女孩!.

results.title: East-Asian primary science curricula : an overview using revised Bloom's taxonomy / Yew-Jin Lee, Mijung Kim, Qingna Jin, Hye-Gyoung Yoon, Kenji Matsubara.
abstracts: This book describes a comparative study of the primary science learning objectives (from the cognitive domain) in the curriculum of six high-achieving East Asian states -- mainland China, Hong Kong, Taiwan, Korea, Japan and Singapore. Specifically, the authors use one of the most widely accepted and useful tools in curriculum research -- revised Bloom's Taxonomy. This is the first time that such findings from all six states have been published in one place and the results are valuable for policymakers, educators and researchers around the globe. Our new English translations of the primary science learning objectives in China, Taiwan and Korea will also greatly facilitate future analyses of these curricula.

results.title: Blended learning in higher education [electronic resource] : framework, principles, and guidelines / D. Randy Garrison, Norman D. Vaughan.
abstracts: "This groundbreaking book offers a down-to-earth resource for the practical application of blended learning in higher education as well as a comprehensive examination of the topic. Well-grounded in research, Blended Learning in Higher Education demonstrates how the blended learning approach embraces the traditional values of face-to-face teaching and integrates the best practices of online learning. This approach has proven to both enhance and expand the effectiveness and efficiency of teaching and learning in higher education across disciplines."--BOOK JACKET.

results.title: Body talk [electronic resource] : a girl's guide to what's happening to your body / Victoria F. Shaw.
abstracts: Provides an overview of the physical and emotional changes brought about by puberty in girls.

results.title: French for dummies [electronic resource] / by Dodi-Katrin Schmidt ... [et al.].
abstracts: Outlines basic French grammar, and offers useful words and expressions and simplified dialogue.

results.title: Twentieth-century sexuality : a history / Angus McLaren.
abstracts: "This book provides a history of sexuality in twentieth-century Europe and North America. Angus McLaren draws upon legal, medical and literary sources to demonstrate how modern sexuality has been shaped by race, class, gender and generational."--Jacket.

results.title: The origins of music / edited by Nils Wallin, Björn Merker, and Steven Brown.
abstracts: Annotation. What biological and cognitive forces have shaped humankind's musical behavior and the rich global repertoire of musical structures? What is music for, and why does every human culture have it? What are the universal features of music and musical behavior across cultures? In this groundbreaking book, musicologists, biologists, anthropologists, archaeologists, psychologists, neuroscientists, ethologists, and linguists come together for the first time to examine these and related issues. The book can be viewed as representing the birth of evolutionary biomusicology -- the study of which will contribute greatly to our understanding of the evolutionary precursors of human music, the evolution of the hominid vocal tract, localization of brain function, the structure of acoustic-communication signals, symbolic gesture, emotional manipulation through sound, self-expression, creativity, the human affinity for the spiritual, and the human attachment to music itself. ContributorsSimha Arom, Derek Bickerton, Steven Brown, Ellen Dissanayake, Dean Falk, David W. Frayer, Walter Freeman, Thomas Geissmann, Marc D. Hauser, Michel Imberty, Harry Jerison, Drago Kunej, Francois-Bernard Mache, Peter Marler, Bjorn Merker, Geoffrey Miller, Jean Molino, Bruno Nettl, Chris Nicolay, Katharine Payne, Bruce Richman, Peter J.B. Slater, Peter Todd, Sandra Trehub, Ivan Turk, Maria Ujhelyi, Nils L. Wallin, Carol Whaling."

results.title: Sounding out heritage [electronic resource] : cultural politics and the social practice of quan họ folk song in northern Vietnam / Lauren Meeker.

Learning science through computer games and simulations [electronic resource] / Committee on Science Learning: Computer Games, Simulations, and Education ; Margaret A. Honey and Margaret L. Hilton, editors ; Board on Science Education, Division of Behavioral and Social Sciences and Education, National Research Council of the National Academies.
authors: National Research Council (U.S.). Committee on Science Learning: Computer Games, Simulations, and Education.
abstracts: At a time when scientific and technological competence is vital to the nation's future, the weak performance of U.S. students in science reflects the uneven quality of current science education. Although young children come to school with innate curiosity and intuitive ideas about the world around them, science classes rarely tap this potential. Many experts have called for a new approach to science education, based on recent and ongoing research on teaching and learning. In this approach, simulations and games could play a significant role by addressing many goals and mechanisms for learning science: the motivation to learn science, conceptual understanding, science process skills, understanding of the nature of science, scientific discourse and argumentation, and identification with science and science learning. To explore this potential this book reviews the available research on learning science through interaction with digital simulations and games. It considers the potential of digital games and simulations to contribute to learning science in schools, in informal out-of-school settings, and everyday life. The book also identifies the areas in which more research and research-based development is needed to fully capitalize on this potential.  It will guide academic researchers, developers, publishers, and entrepreneurs from the digital simulation and gaming community, and education practitioners and policy makers toward the formation of research and development partnerships that will facilitate rich intellectual collaboration. Industry, government agencies and foundations will play a significant role through start-up and ongoing support to ensure that digital games and simulations will not only excite and entertain, but also motivate and educate.

results.title: Musicals : Hollywood and beyond / edited by Bill Marshall and Robynn Stilwell.
abstracts: "This original collection of essays seeks to initiate a new critical debate by approaching classic Hollywood films from perspectives such as 'musicology'. Broadening the scope of previous studies, this volume also examines the manner in which European cinema appropriated the musical to create new meanings. In addition, the book provides an innovative and up-to-date reading of the influence of the musical on youth culture today and its endorsement in modern dance movies, MTV and Music Video." "This is an accessible text for students on degree programmes in Film or Music both in the UK and US. It will also be a welcome resource for those researching and teaching in this area."--Jacket.

results.title: Enhancing e-learning with media-rich content and interactions [electronic resource] / Richard Caladine.
abstracts: "This book presents instructional designers, educators, scholars, and researchers with the necessary foundational elements, theoretical underpinnings, and practical guidance to aid in the technology selection and design of effective online learning experiences by integrating media-rich interactions and content"--Provided by publisher.

results.title: The melodic tradition of Ireland [electronic resource] / James R. Cowdery.
abstracts: This is a major work, at once synthetic and analytical. The author has drawn on previous studies of Irish music and general melodic theory to describe the inner workings of a rich melodic tradition. Irish folk music, resting upon monophonic melodies which are varied and ornamented, and thus viewed from several perspectives; ethnographic and musical, insider and theoretical?to weave an integrated image of a still thriving genre. The concepts of tune family and melody type are starting points for the qualitative study of melodic change and tune relationships without recourse to simplified tune skeletons or statistics. The concept of implicit folk theory leads both to rigorous theoretical analysis and to an examination of the musicians' own words, thus creating a working model in which a particular performance is understood in a larger context. The historic and ethnographic passages convey the setting of the music and suggest the ways in which Irish musicians reflect patterns in culture and patterns in sound.

results.title: The reproductive system [electronic resource] / Alvin, Virginia, and Robert Silverstein.

results.title: Teacher education in the 21st century : Singapore's evolution and innovation / Oon-Seng Tan, Woon-Chia Liu, Ee-Ling Low, editors.
abstracts: This book examines the evolution and innovation of teacher education in Singapore in the 21st century. It covers teacher education reforms in the conceptualising and implementing of the Teacher Education for the 21st Century (TE21) Model and discusses curriculum improvements that are aligned to new competencies; values development that re-envision teacher professionalism and calling; pedagogical changes that emphasise self-directed inquiry and technology-enabled learning; strengthened theory--practice linkages and enhanced teaching practices through school partnerships and mentoring; and impactful education research in areas such as assessment and developing teaching competencies, practices and mentoring. Teacher education in Singapore focuses on developing professional leaders in the field of education who are proactive problem-solvers and empowered researchers. It entails a long-term vision of education and an innovative approach to develop teachers with design skills and an inquiring mindset to understand learners in the fast-changing digital and mobile world. This book is aimed at scholars, researchers, policymakers, teacher educators and teachers as well as anyone interested in learning the philosophy behind Singapore's unique TE21 Model for the 21st century and beyond.

results.title: The complete idiot's guide to playing the harmonica [electronic resource] / by William Melton and Randy Weinstein ; [foreword by Steve Baker].
abstracts: Teaching playing the harmonica in three basic stages, this book emphasises actual practice exercises with blues, rock, bluegrass, folk and jazz music.

results.title: 致, 被儿子搞疯的妈妈. 2, 儿子, 你锁房门在干嘛? / 孙京伊著 ; 樊姗姗译. Zhi, bei er zi gao feng de ma ma. 2, Er zi, ni suo fang men zai gan ma? / Sun Jingyi zhu ; Fan Shanshan yi.
abstracts: 男孩性教育不是丢给爸爸就好! 男孩的成长也不是"就这样啊""不然咧" "管太多了吧", 最后干脆放牛吃草. 其实, 儿子更需要妈妈的关注与呵护! 根据青少年性教育知识调查指出, 现在的孩子"性知识程度超前"! 超过7成的国小生表示了解如何避孕. 这些避孕知识竟有４成是来自同学、朋友和网路..... 但, 让儿子这样学性知识, 妈妈安心吗? 这是深受30万韩国人信赖的性教育专家孙京伊, 为男孩妈妈们写的性教育专书! 问题是, 儿子都会自己去网路爬文、和同学分享, 妈妈还能教儿子什么?.

results.title: 拼教养 : 全球化、亲职焦虑与不平等童年 = Struggling to raise children : globalization, parental anxieties and unequal childhoods / 蓝佩嘉著. Pin jiao yang : quan qiu hua, qin zhi jiao lü yu bu ping deng tong nian = Struggling to raise children : globalization, parental anxieties and unequal childhoods / Lan Peijia zhu.
abstracts: 从台湾"拼经济"的一代成长的父母, 如今"拼教养"成为人生重点. 这一代父母渴望摆脱体罚与联考的阴影, 成为与上一代大不相同的父母, 同时也希望下一代在全球化的时代里, 更有能力与机会去探索世界. 尽管这一代父母拥有比过去更丰富的教养资源, 然而, 教养这件事却让他们益发焦虑, 不时怀疑自己是否做太少、做太多、做不好、做不对? 本书以亲职焦虑为镜, 映现出台湾在全球化脉络中所面对的风险与挑战, 包括相对停滞的本地经济与薪资、与全球资本主义更紧密的连结与竞争、产业变化的不确定性, 而日趋极端的社经阶级差异正透过教养形塑许多孩子的不平等童年.

results.title: STEM education and e-learning
abstracts: This is volume 1 in the "Sustainable Innovations in Education and Technology" series. It is also the conference proceedings of "The Eurasian Conference on Educational Innovation 2018 (ECEI 2018)" held in Macau on January 26-29, 2018". It contains papers on STEM education and e-learning. It includes papers on intuitive thinking and methodological creation in design, using importance-performance matrix analysis to understand training practices on ICT literacy and critical thinking and a systematic and quantifiable approach to teaching elite students preparation of papers in two-column format.

results.title: Information communication technology in education  [electronic resource] :  Singapore’s ICT masterplans, 1997-2008.
abstracts: This book seeks to present a comprehensive review of Singapore's ICT Masterplans in education, providing a rare behind-the-scenes look at policy planning, as well as the lessons learnt and insights gained from the past decade of the use of ICT in teaching and learning. Since 1997 (when the First Masterplan was launched) to 2008, schools and teachers have made great strides in their use of ICT for education at all levels: primary, secondary and junior college.

results.title: Cosmopolitan sex workers [electronic resource] : women and migration in a global city / Christine B.N. Chin.
abstracts: "This text examines the phenomenon of non-trafficked women who choose to migrate from one global city to another to perform paid sexual labour in Southeast Asia. Christine B.N. Chin offers an innovative theoretical framework termed '3C' (city, creativity, and cosmopolitanism) to analyze how factors at the local, state, and individual levels work together to shape women's ability and desire to migrate to perform sex work. Based on original fieldwork in Kuala Lumpur (KL), the study begins by examining KL's transformation into a global city."--Provided by publisher.

results.title: Colonial counterpoint [electronic resource] : music in early modern Manila / D.R.M. Irving.
abstracts: The author reconnects the Philippines to current musicological discourse on the early modern Hispanic world. He uses the metaphors of counterpoint and enharmony to critique musical practices within the colonial milieu. The introduction and institutionalization of counterpoint acted as a powerful agent of colonialism.

results.title: Musical renderings of the Philippine nation [electronic resource] / Christi-Anne Castro.
abstracts: A cultural history of the Philippines during the 20th century, this title focuses on the relationships between music, performance, and ideologies of the nation. Christi-Anne Castro reveals how individuals and groups negotiate with and contest the power of the Philippine state to define the nation as a modern and hybrid entity.

results.title: Sex, love and money in Cambodia : professional girlfriends and transactional relationships / Heidi Hoefinger.
abstracts: Includes bibliographical references and index.

results.title: Divine inspiration [electronic resource] : music and Islam in Indonesia / co-editors David D. Harnish, Anne K. Rasmussen.
abstracts: Includes bibliographical references and index.

results.title: Rasa [electronic resource] : affect and intuition in Javanese musical aesthetics / Marc Benamou.
abstracts: Rasa is the most thorough treatment to date of this all-important concept at the heart of Javanese aesthetics. Rasa encompasses not only affect, mood, and intuition, but also theories of musical perception and cognition, as well as meaning and expression in music.
